intro: Trichosanthes grandibracteata, commonly known as the large bract栝楼, is a climbing vine native to China and Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow flowers with red markings. The plant produces a large, elongated fruit that turns orange when mature. Its botanical features include a robust stem with tendrils and a fibrous, woody interior in its fruit. It is often cultivated for its medicinal properties and ornamental value.
